fields.name: AutoPauseDelay
fields.description: Time in minutes after which database is automatically paused. A value of -1 means that automatic pause is disabled

fields.name: CatalogCollation
fields.description: Collation of the metadata catalog.

fields.name: Collation
fields.description: The collation of the database.

fields.name: CreateMode
fields.description:
Specifies the mode of database creation.

Default: regular database creation.

Copy: creates a database as a copy of an existing database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the resource ID of the source database.

Secondary: creates a database as a secondary replica of an existing database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the resource ID of the existing primary database.

PointInTimeRestore: Creates a database by restoring a point in time backup of an existing database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the resource ID of the existing database, and restorePointInTime must be specified.

Recovery: Creates a database by restoring a geo-replicated backup. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the recoverable database resource ID to restore.

Restore: Creates a database by restoring a backup of a deleted database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified. If sourceDatabaseId is the database's original resource ID, then sourceDatabaseDeletionDate must be specified. Otherwise sourceDatabaseId must be the restorable dropped database resource ID and sourceDatabaseDeletionDate is ignored. restorePointInTime may also be specified to restore from an earlier point in time.

RestoreLongTermRetentionBackup: Creates a database by restoring from a long term retention vault. recoveryServicesRecoveryPointResourceId must be specified as the recovery point resource ID.

Copy, Secondary, and RestoreLongTermRetentionBackup are not supported for DataWarehouse edition.

fields.name: CreationDate
fields.description: The creation date of the database (ISO8601 format).

fields.name: CurrentBackupStorageRedundancy
fields.description: The storage account type used to store backups for this database.

fields.name: CurrentServiceObjectiveName
fields.description: The current service level objective name of the database.

fields.name: DatabaseId
fields.description: The ID of the database.

fields.name: DefaultSecondaryLocation
fields.description: The default secondary region for this database.

fields.name: EarliestRestoreDate
fields.description: This records the earliest start date and time that restore is available for this database (ISO8601 format).

fields.name: ElasticPoolId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the elastic pool containing this database.

fields.name: FailoverGroupId
fields.description: Failover Group resource identifier that this database belongs to.

fields.name: FederatedClientId
fields.description: The Client id used for cross tenant per database CMK scenario

fields.name: HighAvailabilityReplicaCount
fields.description: The number of secondary replicas associated with the database that are used to provide high availability. Not applicable to a Hyperscale database within an elastic pool.

fields.name: IsInfraEncryptionEnabled
fields.description: Infra encryption is enabled for this database.

fields.name: IsLedgerOn
fields.description: Whether or not this database is a ledger database, which means all tables in the database are ledger tables. Note: the value of this property cannot be changed after the database has been created.

fields.name: LicenseType
fields.description: The license type to apply for this database. `LicenseIncluded` if you need a license, or `BasePrice` if you have a license and are eligible for the Azure Hybrid Benefit.

fields.name: LongTermRetentionBackupResourceId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the long term retention backup associated with create operation of this database.

fields.name: MaintenanceConfigurationId
fields.description: Maintenance configuration id assigned to the database. This configuration defines the period when the maintenance updates will occur.

fields.name: MaxLogSizeBytes
fields.description: The max log size for this database.

fields.name: MaxSizeBytes
fields.description: The max size of the database expressed in bytes.

fields.name: MinCapacity
fields.description: Minimal capacity that database will always have allocated, if not paused

fields.name: PausedDate
fields.description: The date when database was paused by user configuration or action(ISO8601 format). Null if the database is ready.

fields.name: ReadScale
fields.description: The state of read-only routing. If enabled, connections that have application intent set to readonly in their connection string may be routed to a readonly secondary replica in the same region. Not applicable to a Hyperscale database within an elastic pool.

fields.name: RecoverableDatabaseId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the recoverable database associated with create operation of this database.

fields.name: RecoveryServicesRecoveryPointId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the recovery point associated with create operation of this database.

fields.name: RequestedBackupStorageRedundancy
fields.description: The storage account type to be used to store backups for this database.

fields.name: RequestedServiceObjectiveName
fields.description: The requested service level objective name of the database.

fields.name: RestorableDroppedDatabaseId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the restorable dropped database associated with create operation of this database.

fields.name: RestorePointInTime
fields.description: Specifies the point in time (ISO8601 format) of the source database that will be restored to create the new database.

fields.name: ResumedDate
fields.description: The date when database was resumed by user action or database login (ISO8601 format). Null if the database is paused.

fields.name: SampleName
fields.description: The name of the sample schema to apply when creating this database.

fields.name: SecondaryType
fields.description: The secondary type of the database if it is a secondary.  Valid values are Geo and Named.

fields.name: SourceDatabaseDeletionDate
fields.description: Specifies the time that the database was deleted.

fields.name: SourceDatabaseId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the source database associated with create operation of this database.

fields.name: SourceResourceId
fields.description:
The resource identifier of the source associated with the create operation of this database.

This property is only supported for DataWarehouse edition and allows to restore across subscriptions.

When sourceResourceId is specified, sourceDatabaseId, recoverableDatabaseId, restorableDroppedDatabaseId and sourceDatabaseDeletionDate must not be specified and CreateMode must be PointInTimeRestore, Restore or Recover.

When createMode is PointInTimeRestore, sourceResourceId must be the resource ID of the existing database or existing sql pool, and restorePointInTime must be specified.

When createMode is Restore, sourceResourceId must be the resource ID of restorable dropped database or restorable dropped sql pool.

When createMode is Recover, sourceResourceId must be the resource ID of recoverable database or recoverable sql pool.

When source subscription belongs to a different tenant than target subscription, “x-ms-authorization-auxiliary” header must contain authentication token for the source tenant. For more details about “x-ms-authorization-auxiliary” header see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/management/authenticate-multi-tenant

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the database.

fields.name: ZoneRedundant
fields.description: Whether or not this database is zone redundant, which means the replicas of this database will be spread across multiple availability zones.
